meanings.definition: A wheeled cart used for transporting goods or luggage.
meanings.sent1: I loaded my bags onto the trolly at the airport.
meanings.sent2: The hotel staff pushed the trolly filled with fresh towels.
meanings.sent3: The trolly carrying groceries decided to take a break by the entrance.
meanings.sent4: The trolly rolled through the market like a busy ant trail.
meanings.sent5: The shiny trolly gleamed under the bright lights of the store.

meanings.definition: A device used for collecting fares on public transportation.
meanings.sent1: The conductor checked my ticket using the trolly on the train.
meanings.sent2: Passengers dropped coins into the trolly before finding a seat.
meanings.sent3: The trolly on the bus seemed to have a mind of its own, beeping cheerfully.
meanings.sent4: The trolly chimed like a tiny bell as it processed each payment.
meanings.sent5: The trolly's screen displayed the fare amount clearly for all to see.

meanings.sent1: The cat likes to trolly around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he decided to trolly through the park.
meanings.sent3: The children trollyed through the house, looking for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would trolly from one idea to the next, never settling.
meanings.sent5: The clouds trollyed lazily across the sky, in no hurry to reach their destination.
